io.spine.server

Class BoundedContextBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.BoundedContextBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.spine.logging.Logging

    public final class BoundedContextBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.spine.logging.Logging
    A builder for producing BoundedContext instances.

    An application can have more than one bounded context. To distinguish them use BoundedContextBuilder.setName(String). If no ID is given the default ID will be assigned.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public BoundedContextBuilder setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the value of the name for a new bounded context.

        It is the responsibility of an application developer to provide meaningful and unique names for bounded contexts. The framework does not check for duplication of names.

        If the name is not defined in the builder, the context will get BoundedContextNames.assumingTests() name.

        Parameters:
        name - an identifier string for a new bounded context. Cannot be null, empty, or blank

      • setName

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue

        Sets the name for a new bounded context.

        It is the responsibility of an application developer to provide meaningful and unique names for bounded contexts. The framework does not check for duplication of names.

        If the name is not defined in the builder, the context will get BoundedContextNames.assumingTests() name.

        Parameters:
        name - an identifier string for a new bounded context. Cannot be null, empty, or blank

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public BoundedContextBuilder setStorageFactorySupplier(@Nullable java.util.function.Supplier<StorageFactory> supplier)
        Sets the supplier for StorageFactory.

        If the supplier was not set or null was passed, StorageFactorySwitch will be used during the construction of a BoundedContext instance.

      • build

        public BoundedContext build()
        Creates a new instance of BoundedContext with the set configurations.

        The resulting domain-specific bounded context has as internal System Bounded Context. The entities of the System domain describe the entities of the resulting Bounded Context.

        The System Bounded Context shares some configuration with the Domain Bounded Context, such as:

        • BoundedContextBuilder.getTenantIndex() tenancy;
        • BoundedContextBuilder.getStorageFactory() storage facilities;
        • BoundedContextBuilder.getTransportFactory() transport facilities.

        All the other configuration is NOT shared.

        The name of the System bounded context is derived from the name of the domain bounded context.

        Returns:
        new BoundedContext
